intro: Manisuris talbotii, commonly known as the Talbot's manisuris, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the mild, humid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
